title: Bi-Weekly Career and Hiring Discussion Thread
selftext:
Hello r/india! If you need any suggestions/help regarding your career, ask here. If your company is hiring or if you are looking for a job, then post here.

**If You or Your Company is Hiring:**

1. Name of the company
2. Location
3. Requirements
4. Preferred way of contacting you

**If You are looking to get hired**

1. Your skillset/experience
2. Portfolio (if any/applicable)
3. Location
4. Preferred way of contacting you

Please do not mention your emails. You can/should prefer to take conversation forward in PMs instead to avoid any privacy mishaps.

Do follow up here with your experience. Did you get a job or hire someone successfully via these threads? Your feedback helps!

**Career Thread is posted every two weeks on Thursday mornings |** [**Old Threads**](https://reddit.com/r/india/search?q=Career+and+Hiring+thread&restrict_sr=on&sort=new&t=all)

comments:
Looking for a role in Political Consulting

YoE: 2.5+ years across Design and Strategy roles 
Qualifications: Bachelor's 
Contact: DM

Uneecops Business Solutions

Noida

Sql and tableau

DM.

My wife is looking to change her career to non-Sales.

1. PGDM Marketing and HR, BE in Electrical and Electronics
2. Total EXP. 4+ years. Mostly in Sales and several roles within startups. 
2. Skillset: Power BI, SQL, MS Excel, Marketing Research, Key Account Management.
3. Trying hard for Data analyst role with internships she did, but having no written Experience in a company is making it impossible to find a job. (Catch 22 situation).

We're located in Mumbai, and looking for any Mumbai/Pune/Remote roles. Any help is appreciated.

Looking for my first permanent role.   


1. BS Economics from a Tier 1 College.
2. Just graduated. Slightly unsure of what role I fit in. Preparing for CFA while interning in the holding company of an MNC.
3. Skillet: R, Stata, SQL, Excel, R&A in Economics stuff. Lots of PG Finance courses done in UG. 
4. Location any. Want to get to finance. If you have no roles but can give some advice, would be helpful too.
